name: Clavis Connector (Decommissioned)
description: A connector service between Salsify and Clavis that has been decommissioned. It enabled data syndication to Clavis, a retail analytics platform. Included a Target Schema (TS) generator that dynamically created schemas based on retailer information, scheduled jobs for updating retailer data, and FTP-based feedback delivery. The connector stored credentials in S3 and published to retailers organized by markets with UPC-level and RPC-level fields.

name: Clavis - Retail Analytics Platform
description: A third-party retail analytics platform that receives product data from Salsify via the clavis-connector. Clavis provides feedback via CSV files sent over FTP. Product data is organized by retailers and markets, with each customer having a Clavis-specific naming convention for their organization.

name: Retailer Product Code
description: In the context of Clavis connector, RPC refers to retailer-specific product codes at the case level. RPC-level fields are unique per retailer and grouped within 'Case RPC-Level Fields' in the target schema. Each retailer has its own prefix concatenated with RPC field names.

name: Target Schema
description: In connector contexts, TS is the abbreviation for Target Schema - the structured definition of data fields required by a retail channel. For Clavis, the TS is dynamically generated from retailer information stored in S3, containing fields for applicable retailers, UPC-level fields per market, and RPC-level fields per retailer.

name: Applicable Retailers - Clavis TS Field
description: A required classifier field in the Clavis target schema that lists all retailers a product is sold at. Contains an enumerated list of retailer names as field values, used to scope other fields in the schema based on which retailers are selected.

name: NTC - Jira Project
description: A Jira project identifier used at Salsify. Referenced in the clavis-connector decommission ticket (NTC-2129).
